original: Lindberg, Harry Mauritz Emanuel, rådman, Göteborg, f. 20/9/94 i Gbg av just:borgm. Bernhard L. o. Aurora Hagelqvist. G. 25 m. Brita Almqvist. Barn: Bengt f. 27, Barbro 30. — Stud:-ex. v. Gbgs h. latin 12, jur. kand. i Sthlm 22. Tingstjg. i Askims, Hisings o. Sävedals häradsr. 22-23, tjg. v. Gbgs rådhusr. fr. 23, assessor där 34, rådman samt v. ordf. å tredje avd. sed. 45. Sekr. h. styr. f. sjöfartsmus, i Gbg sed. 26, sekr. o. styr :led. i Fören, t. förmån f. Pauvres Honteux i Gbg sed. 28, suppl. i överstyr, f. Riksfören. f, svenskh. bev. i uti. 28-47, sekr. o. styr:led. i Gbgs trädgrfören. sed. 30, kronoombud v. tax. 30-35, sekr. h. styr. f. Gbgs stads sjömanshem sed. 34, ordf. i taxmd 36-45, i Gbgs Barnens Dagsfören. sed. 37, v. ordf. i lokalfören, av Riksfören. f. svenskh. bevar. i uti. 38-46, led. av stadsfullm. byggn :komm. f. ett nytt sjömanshem i Gbg 40-44, ordf. i Sv res redarefören. o. Sv. sjöfolksförb. undisökn:- o. be-straffn:nd sed. 44, suppl. i styr. f. Gbgs Sparbank 39-43, led. sed. 44, suppl. i styr. f. Gbgs Ränte- o. kapi-talförsäkr lanst. sed. 44, v. ordf. i Sv:es Barnens Dagsledares fören. sed. 44, ordf. i styr. f. Segelsällsk. Aeolus i Gbg sed. 44, ordf. i centr:styr. f. Gbgs arb rstugor sed. 46. Skr.: Göta Pro-vinsial-Loge 1788-1938 (minnesskr. 38), Från Segerlindska ängeh t. Trägår’n (42). RVO.
translated: Lindberg, Harry Mauritz Emanuel, magistrate, Gothenburg, born on September 20, 1894 in Gothenburg, son of just: magistrate Bernhard L. and Aurora Hagelqvist. Married on May 25 with Brita Almqvist. Children: Bengt, born in 1927, Barbro, born in 1930. Completed high school diploma at Gothenburg's Latin School in 1912, graduated with a law degree in Stockholm in 1922. Judicial service in Askims, Hisings, and Sävedal district courts from 1922 to 1923, served at Gothenburg City Hall from 1923, appointed as assessor in 1934, magistrate and vice chairman of the third department since 1945. Secretary of the board for the Maritime Museum in Gothenburg since 1926, secretary and board member of the Association for the Benefit of the Needy in Gothenburg since 1928, substitute in the supervisory board of the National Association for the Preservation of Swedish Customs Abroad from 1928 to 1947, secretary and board member of the Gothenburg Horticultural Society since 1930, official representative in charge of taxation from 1930 to 1935, secretary of the board for the Gothenburg Seamen's Home since 1934, chairman of the taxation committee from 1936 to 1945, chairman of the Gothenburg Children's Day Association since 1937, vice chairman of the local association of the National Association for the Preservation of Swedish Customs Abroad from 1938 to 1946, member of the building committee for a new seamen's home in Gothenburg from 1940 to 1944, chairman of the Swedish Shipowners' Association and Swedish Seafarers' Union in the investigation and punishment committee since 1944, substitute in the board of directors for Gothenburg Savings Bank from 1939 to 1943, member since 1944, substitute in the board of directors for Gothenburg Mortgage and Capital Insurance State since 1944, vice chairman of the Swedish Children's Day Leaders' Association since 1944, chairman of the board for the Aeolus Sailing Club in Gothenburg since 1944, chairman of the central board for Gothenburg's workrooms since 1946. Published works: Göta Provincial Lodge 1788-1938 (memoir, 1938), From Segerlindska ängeh to Trägår'n (1942). Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa.
